abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Agriculture
            Strengthening and Accession Project for Macedonia is to
            improve the delivery of the Borrower's assistance to
            the agriculture sector in a manner consistent with the
            European Union's (EU) pre-accession requirements. The
            closing date for the project be extended from June 30, 2012
            until December 31, 2012. The extension is necessary to allow
            additional time for remaining project activities to be
            completed. One ongoing specific and complex activity, the
            development of the Integrated Administrative and Control
            System (IACS) requires 49 weeks starting from the day of
            signing the Contract with the selected firm. The integration
            of these systems through the IACS allows the Ministry of
            Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy (MAFWE) and the
            Paying Agency to create and implement agricultural policies
            through subsidies granted to farmers. This system also
            allows accurate and prompt updating and digitalizing of data
            on farmers and farms. The Bank team has assessed and
            discussed progress under this activity during an
            Implementation Support Mission on September 26-30, 2011. On
            December 13, 2011, the Government signed the contract with
            Consortium Abaco, Sinergise and PR Tehnologii Mantova, Italy
            for the supply and installation of IACS. With respect to the
            remaining reconstruction and refurbishment activities
            (listed in the letter from the Government), these activities
            are on track to be completed by the planned dates. The
            project team fully supports the request as the proposed
            extension will provide the time needed to fully achieve
            project objectives. This will be the second extension of the project.
